Data.TextElement: EDR adjusted Q1/17 EPS of $0.01 was in line with our estimates and slightly below consensus. Operating cash flow and FCF came in ahead of our expectation at ~$10M and $0.3M, respectively. Capital expenditures were light on the quarter and we expect spending to rise through the remained of 2017 to meet guidance.

EDR reported Q1/17 headline EPS $0.05, after adjusting for foreign exchange gains adj. EPS came in at $0.01, in line our estimate of $0.01 and slightly below consensus at $0.02.

EDR pre-announced Q1/17 production of 1.1Moz silver and 11.7koz gold. Silver by-product cash costs and AISC for Q1/17 came in at $7.81/oz and $18.24/oz, respectively, above FY2017 guidance. The company made no changes to its 2017 guidance of 5.2-5.7Moz silver and 50-53koz gold at by-product AISC of $14.00-15.00/oz.

Q1/17 reported operating cash flow and FCF of ~$10M and $0.3M, above our expectations of $7M and negative $11M, respectively.

Given the company has only spent 12% of planned capital expenditures, we expect spending to increase through he remainder of 2017.

EDR exited the quarter with $71M in cash and $6.5M in short-term debt.

Conference call today at 12:00 a.m. ET; Tel: 800-319-4610.

EDR adjusted Q1/17 EPS of $0.01 was in line with our estimates and slightly below consensus. Operating cash flow and FCF came in ahead of our expectation at ~$10M and $0.3M, respectively. Capital expenditures were light on the quarter and we expect spending to rise through the remained of 2017 to meet guidance.
All values are listed in thousands unless stated otherwise.
Data.BoilerPlate: EDR is a "transition story," with plans to increase production by 50% by 2019E through the development of Terronera. AISC are expected to decline 30% over the same time frame.

Our valuation is based on a 2017E payable production forecast of 5.4Moz silver and 54koz gold at co-product all-in sustaining cost of US$21.44/oz silver equivalent. The target price is based on a 50/50 weighted blend of 1.7x P/NPV adjusted for market capitalization and 10.0x P/CF adjusted for growth.
3.0x NAV multiple at BMO prices ($20/oz long term).
1.0x NAV multiple. Spot silver price declines back to $15/oz level and sector multiples collapse.

Endeavour Silver operates three mines located in historical silver districts in Mexico. The company is focused on evaluating and developing its greenfields pipeline of the prospective El Compas, Terronera and Parral projects.

Target prices for senior and intermediate silver/gold producers covered by BMO Research are based on a 50/50 weighted blend of 1.7x P/NPV adjusted for market capitalization and 10.0x P/CF adjusted for growth.

Risks to the BMO Research target price include commodity/currency, technical/operating, and litigation/political risks inherent to mining operations; as well as feasibility, permitting and financing risks related to development of growth projects as detailed more completely in the company-specific risk disclosures.
Market Impact Boiler Plate Testing testing testing testing testing testing testing testing testing testing testing testing testing

This is the Surpluses Changes Market Behavior boiler plate - testing the sector specific boiler plates -testing testing testing testing testing testing testing testing testing testing testing testing testing
Industry Overview testing testing testing testing testing testing testing testing testing testing testing

In January, EDR reported Q4/16 silver and gold production of 5.4Moz and 57koz, respectively. FY2016 production of 5.4Moz silver and 57koz gold, missed and exceeded 2016 guidance of 5.5-6.0Moz silver and 49-54koz gold, respectively. The company expects AISC for FY2016 to register lower than its original guidance at $13-14/oz, but have indicated that costs will rise in Q4 as reinvestments are made in sustaining development and exploration. EDR reported production guidance for 2017 of 5.2-5.7Moz silver and 50-53koz gold with AISC guidance for 2017 of $14.50-15.50/oz. The company also budgeted $71M in sustaining, $8M in growth capital and $15M in exploration for 2017.

Going forward in March, EDR is expecting to deliver a Preliminary Economic Assessment (PEA) and initial resource estimate at El Compas and the Pre-Feasibility Study (PFS) for Terronera as its initial steps towards the Mexican growth strategy of building three mines in three years (El Compas, Terronera, and Parral).

Ratings Key (as of October 2016)

We use the following ratings system definitions:
OP = Outperform - Forecast to outperform the analyst’s coverage universe on a total return basis;
Mkt = Market Perform - Forecast to perform roughly in line with the analyst’s coverage universe on a total return basis;
Und = Underperform - Forecast to underperform the analyst’s coverage universe on a total return basis;
(S) = Speculative investment;
Spd = Suspended - Coverage and rating suspended until coverage is reinstated;
NR = No Rated - No rating at this time; and
R = Restricted - Dissemination of research is currently restricted.

BMO Capital Markets' seven Top 15 lists guide investors to our best ideas according to different objectives (CDN Large Cap, CDN Small Cap, US Large Cap, US Small Cap, Income, CDN Quant, and US Quant have replaced the Top Pick rating).

Dissemination of Research

Dissemination of BMO Capital Markets Equity Research is available via our website https://research-ca.bmocapitalmarkets.com/Public/Secure/Login.aspx? ReturnUrl=/Member/Home/ResearchHome.aspx. Institutional clients may also receive our research via Thomson Reuters, Bloomberg, FactSet, and Capital IQ. Research reports and other commentary are required to be simultaneously disseminated internally and externally to our clients.

~ Research distribution and approval times are provided on the cover of each report. Times are approximations as system and distribution processes are not exact and can vary based on the sender and recipients’ services. Unless otherwise noted, times are Eastern Standard and when two times are provided, the approval time precedes the distribution time.

BMO Capital Markets may use proprietary models in the preparation of reports. Material information about such models may be obtained by contacting the research analyst directly. There is no planned frequency of updates to this report.

Additional Matters

To Canadian Residents: BMO Nesbitt Burns Inc. furnishes this report to Canadian residents and accepts responsibility for the contents herein subject to the terms set out above. Any Canadian person wishing to effect transactions in any of the securities included in this report should do so through BMO Nesbitt Burns Inc.

The following applies if this research was prepared in whole or in part by Alexander Pearce, David Round, Edward Sterck or Brendan Warn: This research is not prepared subject to Canadian disclosure requirements. This research is prepared by BMO Capital Markets Limited and subject to the regulations of the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) in the United Kingdom. FCA regulations require that a firm providing research disclose its ownership interest in the issuer that is the subject of the research if it and its affiliates own 5% or more of the equity of the issuer. Canadian regulations require that a firm providing research disclose its ownership interest in the issuer that is the subject of the research if it and its affiliates own 1% or more of the equity of the issuer that is the subject of the research. Therefore BMO Capital Markets Limited will disclose its and its affiliates' ownership interest in the subject issuer only if such ownership exceeds 5% of the equity of the issuer.
